terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A unified approach to storing all documentation in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple systems or departments
The ability for changes made to documents or data to be immediately reflected and synchronized across all users and systems without delay
Pre-configured sequences of tasks that execute automatically based on triggers or conditions, reducing manual intervention in documentation processes
Pre-designed document formats that provide a standardized structure and layout for creating consistent documentation
Tools that enable multiple users to work together on documents simultaneously, including commenting, editing, and review capabilities
The process of connecting different software systems or tools so they can share data and work together seamlessly
A comprehensive software environment that provides the foundation and tools for creating, managing, and delivering applications or services
Environmental Impact Assessment - a systematic process to evaluate the potential environmental effects of a proposed project or development
Carbon Capture and Storage - a technology that captures carbon dioxide emissions from industrial processes and stores them underground to prevent atmospheric release
Documentation that is organized, complete, and easily accessible in a format that meets regulatory inspection and compliance review requirements
Tools that allow users to quickly locate specific information within large document repositories using keywords, filters, or advanced query options
Automated alerts sent to users when specific events occur, such as document updates, approval requests, or system changes
